Agary pharmaceutical limited, was established in 1992 as a national and regional marketing company that specializes in the importation and distribution of medical and hospital consumables. When marketing our product we provide a wide range of services to our distributors. From small business to big conglomorates, Agary pharmaceutical Ltd works round the clock to bring our clients imaginations to life and move them forward. For close to two decades, Agary pharmacetical Ltd has worked with a wide array of customers and consultants in numerous fields and specialization, we pride ourselves as number one in hospital consumables. Our diverse client roster has resulted in a flexible big-picture view of the Pharmaceutical industry that many client and consumers overlook by seeking our niche markets. We have a wide range of experience working in the pharmaceutical industry, we specialize in hospital consumables.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Pharmacist
Job Location: Airport Road, Kano 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Business Development Pharmacist to join our team.
	In this role, you will support the growth and expansion of our pharmaceutical products and services by identifying opportunities, building client relationships, and assisting in strategic initiatives.
	Ideal candidates are proactive, possess strong communication skills, and have a foundational understanding of the pharmaceutical market.


Requirements


	Bachelor of Pharmacy
	years’ experience in product management, branding, medical marketing, in pharmaceutical space
	Strong understanding of drug mechanisms, formulations, and market dynamics.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Creative mindset with a keen eye for brand presentation, packaging, and messaging.
	Ability to collaborate across departments
	Familiarity with regulatory guidelines (NAFDAC, PCN, SON etc.) as they relate to promotional materials

Head, Account and Finance Job at Enov8 Solutions




        
    

        
        Enov8 Solutions was established in 2018 with head office in Lagos Nigeria. We are a software development focused company with the believe that business process automation is a business challenge and should be pursued as interplay of seven business levers namely Strategy, People, Process, Metrics, Applications, Data and architecture.

At Enov8 we provide IT solutions using either OEM products of our partners or our proprietary solutions or a mix. At Enov8 we bring industry best practices to bare in developing solutions to enhance our client’s processes while leveraging on our growing executive team, dynamic staff strength and corporate culture as well as forge strategic partnerships and alliances.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Account and Finance

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day accounting activities, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger entries.
	Provide overall leadership and direction for the Accounts and Finance department.
	Oversee day-to-day accounting operations including accounts payable, receivable, payroll, general ledger, and bank reconciliations.
	Prepare, review, and present monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, management reports, and forecasts.
	Lead budgeting, financial planning, cash flow management, and variance analysis.
	Ensure full compliance with statutory, regulatory, and tax requirements.
	Manage audits, tax filings, and engagements with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies.
	Strengthen internal control systems, financial policies, and risk management frameworks.
	Drive cost containment initiatives and improve financial efficiency across the organization.
	Supervise, mentor, and appraise finance team members.
	Coordinate with internal stakeholders to provide financial insights for strategic decision-making.
	Continuously identify process improvement opportunities and implement best financial practices.
	Perform high-level financial analysis and ad-hoc reporting as required by management and the Board.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	8 - 10 years of relevant accounting experience, with at least 4–5 years in a managerial/senior leadership role.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, CPA, or equivalent) is mandatory.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@enov8solutions.tech using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant - Operations",
  "description": "Green Space Farms (GSF) was launched in 2016. We launched with venture capital funding and supervision. Put simply, our core objective is to practice Sustainable farming which makes us a good custodian of the Land and God&rsquo;s given natural resources. We are also engaging the local community to be part of our success story by providing them with employment and professional advisory services for local subsistence farmers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Posisition: Executive Assistant - Operations

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	Administrative support services to the CEO.
	Manage sensitive data for the CEO and Organisation
	Examine documents for the CEO&rsquo;s review to ensure quality control and compliance with company&rsquo;s procedures and policies.
	Monitor and manage the CEO&rsquo;s internal and external correspondence.
	Manage regulatory compliances and renewal of Expert quotas for all International Staff .
	Develop corporate communication materials for the Company.

	We&#39;re seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Bank &amp; Cash Operations Analyst to manage and support daily bank and cash activities across the organization.

	Support intercompany cash transfers and settlements.


Reconciliations:


	Perform daily, weekly, and monthly bank reconciliations.
	Investigate and resolve discrepancies between bank statements and ledger entries.
	Collaborate with accounting teams to ensure accurate financial reporting.


Compliance &amp; Controls:


	Ensure adherence to internal controls, policies, and treasury procedures.
	Support audit requests and provide required documentation.
	Maintain compliance with banking regulations and internal governance standards.


Systems &amp; Reporting:


	Utilize D365 and treasury management systems for processing and reporting.

	Clear Communication: Explain financial processes clearly and respectfully.
	Integrity &amp; Confidentiality: Manage financial data with high ethical standards.
	Accuracy &amp; Quality: Deliver precise work that meets compliance and audit requirements.
